edge_1: Abbie Hoffman openly antagonized Judge Julius Hoffman during the trial.
edge_2: Judge Julius Hoffman showed significant prejudice for the prosecution and insisted that he and Abbie Hoffman are not related.
edge_3: In August 1968, Abbie Hoffman and Jerry Rubin made preparations to protest at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

edge_1: During the trial, Fred Hampton showed support for Seale, which Judge Julius Hoffman assumed was legal help.
edge_2: In retaliation for Seale continuing to speak up for his constitutional rights, Judge Hoffman had him taken to another room, beaten, and returned gagged and chained.
edge_3: Judge Hoffman feels that Hayden is genuinely remorseful during the trial.

edge_1: Abbie agrees to testify for Hayden who asks her to do so.
edge_2: An enraged Hayden exclaimed, "If blood is going to flow, then let it flow all over the city!" in response to police clubbing Davis's head.
